plan: In the next few rounds, I plan to monitor the market closely to understand the trend of the stock price. I will start by not trading in the practice rounds to avoid unnecessary risks. If the stock price falls below the buyback price of 14, I will consider buying more shares. If the price remains high, I will keep my cash and earn the 5% interest per period. I will adjust my strategy based on the observed market trends and the performance of my forecasts.
insight: The current market price of 14 for the stock is higher than its buyback value at the end of the experiment. This indicates a potential overvaluation of the stock. Holding cash might be a safer strategy due to the guaranteed 5% interest rate per period. It's crucial to monitor the market trends to make informed decisions about buying or selling stock.

plan: For the next few rounds, I will continue to monitor the market closely to see if the stock price stabilizes around the buyback value of 14. If the price drops below 14, I will consider buying more shares. If the price stays at or above 14, I will hold my current position and continue to earn dividends and interest. I will also keep an eye on the market volume to gauge the liquidity and interest in the stock. My forecasts will be adjusted based on the observed trends and the buyback value.
insight: The market price has adjusted to the buyback value of 14, which suggests that the market is recognizing the fundamental value of the stock. Holding cash remains a safe strategy due to the guaranteed 5% interest rate per period, but holding stock at the buyback value also ensures a return through dividends. The decision to buy or sell will depend on whether the price deviates from the buyback value, and the potential for capital gains or losses.
